raimbaul.philosophers_V0

Class SpaceAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • raimbaul.philosophers_V0.SpaceAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryListener

    public class SpaceAccessor
extends Object
implements net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryListener
    A class which supports a simple JINI multicast lookup. It doesn't register with any ServiceRegistrars it simply interrogates each one that's discovered for a ServiceItem associated with the passed interface class. i.e. The service needs to already have registered because we won't notice new arrivals. [ServiceRegistrar is the interface implemented by JINI lookup services].
    Version:
    1.00, 7/9/2003
    Author:
    Dan Creswell (dan@dancres.org)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpaceAccessor

        public SpaceAccessor(Class aServiceInterface)
        Parameters:
        aServiceInterface - the class of the type of service you are looking for. Class is usually an interface class.

    • Method Detail

      • getService

        public Object getService()
        Having created a Lookup (which means it now knows what type of service you require), invoke this method to attempt to locate a service of that type. The result should be cast to the interface of the service you originally specified to the constructor.
        Returns:
        proxy for the service type you requested - could be an rmi stub or an intelligent proxy.

      • terminate

        void terminate()
        Location of a service causes the creation of some threads. Call this method to shut those threads down either before exiting or after a proxy has been returned from getService().

      • waitForProxy

        private Object waitForProxy()
        Caller of getService ends up here, blocked until we find a proxy.
        Returns:
        the newly downloaded proxy

      • signalGotProxy

        private void signalGotProxy(Object aProxy)
        Invoked to inform a blocked client waiting in waitForProxy that one is now available.
        Parameters:
        aProxy - the newly downloaded proxy

      • discovered

        public void discovered(net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryEvent anEvent)
        Everytime a new ServiceRegistrar is found, we will be called back on this interface with a reference to it. We then ask it for a service instance of the type specified in our constructor.
        Specified by:
        discovered in interface net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryListener

      • discarded

        public void discarded(net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryEvent anEvent)
        When a ServiceRegistrar "disappears" due to network partition etc. we will be advised via a call to this method - as we only care about new ServiceRegistrars, we do nothing here.
        Specified by:
        discarded in interface net.jini.discovery.DiscoveryListener

      • getSpace

        public static net.jini.space.JavaSpace getSpace()

        public static net.jini.core.transaction.server.TransactionManager getManager()
